greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with first run [0,1] then, for n >= 2, the n-th run has length 2^n and is the concatenation of [a(1),a(2),...,a(2^n/2)] and [n-a(1),n-a(2),...,n-a(2^n/2)].
formula: Let T(n)=A010060(n) then for n>=1 a(2n)=a(n)+1-T(n-1) and a(2n+1)=a(n+1)+T(n).
For k>=0 a(3*2^k+1)=1 (more precisely a(n)=1 iff n is in A103204), a(2^k+1)=k+1, a(5*2^k+1)=2, a(7*2^k+1)=k+2 etc.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 16 2013
